block-definition.s: square of distance from features %'features 1' to %'features 2'
block-definition.comment: When comparing distances one can save some time by avoiding many calls to square root. See also the 'distance from features ...' block.

block-definition.translations: de:kombiniere mit _ die Elemente von _

block-definition.comment: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosine_similarity There is a pure Snap! version of this. Note that the 'features closest to list of features' block should be used to compare one list with a list of lists because it much faster.

Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Can be the language name in English or itself. Or the official code for the language such as fr-FR for French in France. Also used as the default language for the word embedding blocks.

block-definition.s: all words in language %'language' with features
block-definition.comment: Reports all the words that have a list of features accessible via the "features of" reporter block. Data obtained from https://github.com/facebookresearch/fastText

block.comment: Convert from 0 to 1 coordinates to Snap! coordinates.

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.
block-definition.translations: de:drucke _ in Größe _

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

block-definition.s: Wikipedia summary of covid-19 from 6 April 2020

block.l: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The outbreak was first noted in Wuhan, Hubei province, China, in December 2019. The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the outbreak to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020 and recognized it as a pandemic on 11 March 2020. As of 6 April 2020, more than 1,270,000 cases of COVID-19 have been reported in over 200 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 69,400 deaths. More than 260,000 people have recovered. The virus is mainly spread during close contact, and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking. These small droplets may also be produced during breathing, but rapidly fall to the ground or surfaces and are not generally spread through the air over large distances. People may also catch COVID-19 by touching a contaminated surface and then their face. The virus can survive on surfaces for up to 72 hours. It is most contagious during the first 3 days after symptom onset, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease. The time between exposure and symptom onset is typically around five days, but may range from 2 to 14 days. Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome. There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment. Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy. Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected. Efforts to prevent the virus spread include travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, event postponements and cancellations, and facility closures. These include national or regional quarantines throughout the world (starting with the quarantine of Hubei), curfew measures in mainland China, various border closures or incoming passenger restrictions, screening at airports and train stations, and outgoing passenger travel bans. The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, and cultural events, and widespread fears of supply shortages resulting in panic buying. Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in more than 160 countries, affecting approximately 97 percent of the world's student population. Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from hotspots.

block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.
A concise shortcut to the 'features of ...' block. It uses English.
A concise shortcut to the 'closest word to ...' block. Uses English and excludes no words.

custom-block.s: closest word to %l %br in language %txt %br not including %l

block-definition.comment: This block allows you to set the pen's color, transparency (on a scale from 0=opaque to 100=invisible), or size (in pixels). The color can be set in many ways, including RGB values, HSV values, HSL values, fair HSV or HSL (based on a modified spectrum that gives each spectral color equal space and promotes brown to a color), color number, crayon, or X11/W3C color name. See Appendix A in the Snap! Reference Manual for details.

input.options: color color number crayon fair hue ~1 size transparency X11/W3C name ~2 (3D color spaces)={ fair HSL={ fair hue fair saturation (HSL) fair lightness fair HSL vector } fair HSV={ fair hue fair saturation (HSV) fair value (brightness) fair HSV vector } HSL={ hue saturation (HSL) lightness HSL vector } HSV={ hue saturation (HSV) value (brightness) HSV vector } RGB (0-255)={ red green blue RGB(A) vector RGB(A) hex } }

scripts.comment: Note to myself: When the user sets a fair dimension, say fair HSL, variable HSL contains the corresponding "unfair" values, and "raw HSL" contains the numbers the user actually gave. It has to be this way because in the case of HSV, there is no "HSV" variable; rather, we use the pen's actual remembered-by-Javascript color's HSV coordinates. So our HSL variable has to be analogous to that. In both cases "raw" means the numbers the user gave us.

block-definition.comment: Sets the pen color to one of 100 preselected colors, like a box of 100 crayons. The colors have names that are meant to be evocative. They are organized in families, more or less corresponding to spectral (rainbow) colors; the input slot has a two-level menu in which you can hover over a family name to see the colors of that family, each including a crayon number and an RGB value. See Appendix A of the Snap! Reference Manual for more details.

custom-block.s: set pen color to r: %n g: %n b: %n

block-definition.s: set pen color to r: %'r' g: %'g' b: %'b'
block-definition.comment: Takes three inputs for red, green, and blue values, each between 0 and 255. 0,0,0 is black; 255,255,255 is white. 255,255,0 is yellow, and so on. The SET PEN block in this library lets you set individual red, green, or blue without changing the others, lets you provide a list of three RGB color components, and lets you provide a six-digit hexadecimal number, the form in which RGB color values are usually found online. See Appendix A of the Snap! Reference Manual for details.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera a cor da tua caneta para vermelho _ , verde _ e azul _ (0 a 255)

block-definition.s: set pen color to h: %'h' s: %'s' v: %'v'
block-definition.comment: Takes three inputs for hue, saturation, and value ("brightness") values, each between 0 and 1. 0,0,0 is black; 0,0,1 is white. 0.15,1,1 is yellow, and so on. The SET PEN block in this library lets you set individual hue, saturation, or value without changing the others, lets you provide a list of three HSV color components, and lets you use the very much superior HSL (hue, saturation, lightness) color space. See Appendix A of the Snap! Reference Manual for details.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera a cor da caneta para matiz _ , saturação _ e brilho _ (0 a 1)

block-definition.comment: Reports the current pen color as a list of three RGB values in the range 0-255. The PEN block in this library provides a large set of ways to examine the color. See Appendix A in the Snap! Reference Manual for details.
block-definition.translations: pt:a cor da caneta em RGB (vermelho, verde e azul; 0 a 255)

block-definition.comment: Reports the current pen color as a list of three HSV values in the range 0-1. See Appendix A in the Snap! Reference Manual for details.
block-definition.translations: pt:a cor da caneta em HSV (matiz, saturação e brilho, 0 a 1)

block-definition.comment: This block creates new variables on the selected scope: global (for all sprites), sprite (for this sprite only) or script (only for that blocks stack) with the names given (in 'names' list). If there is already a variable with that name in that scope, it does nothing: no errors and no overwrites.
block-definition.translations: pt:cria as variáveis _ _ ca:crea les _ variables _ es:crear las _ variables _ de:erstellen _ var _

block-definition.comment: This block reports "true" if there is a variable with this given name (input slot) in that context. It can be a global, sprite or script variable. Otherwise it reports "false".
block-definition.translations: pt:a variável _ existe ca:existeix la variable _ ? es:existe la variable _ ? de:existiert var _ ?

block-definition.comment: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. The token count of your prompt plus max_tokens cannot exceed the model's context length. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens.

Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics. More info at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. More info at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

block-definition.s: stop completing before generating any of %'stop'
complete %'prompt' using Jurassic 1 engine named %'engine' with key %'api key' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Ask the specified Jurassic 1 engine to complete the prompt with the options provided. Input 3 must be your OpenAI API key which you can obtain from ai21.com For documentation on the options see https://studio.ai21.com/docs/api/

block.comment: Ignore empty options.
Extracts the completion text from the response.
Extracts the error message from the response.

block-definition.comment: The maximum number of tokens to generate per result. Optional, default = 16. If no stopSequences are given, generation is stopped after producing maxTokens.

Modifies the distribution from which tokens are sampled. Optional, default = 1.0. Setting temperature to 1.0 samples directly from the model distribution. Lower (higher) values increase the chance of sampling higher (lower) probability tokens. A value of 0 essentially disables sampling and results in greedy decoding, where the most likely token is chosen at every step.
Sample tokens from the corresponding top percentile of probability mass. Optional, default = 1.0. For example, a value of 0.9 will only consider tokens comprising the top 90% probability mass.

Applies a fixed bias against generating tokens that appeared at least once in the prompt or in the completion. A positive penalty value implies reducing the probability of repetition. Read more at https://studio.ai21.com/docs/api/#repetition-penalties

Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. More info at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

block-definition.s: stop completing before generating any of %'stop' (J1)
block-definition.comment: Stops decoding if any of the stop texts is generated. The decoded result text will not include the stop sequence text, but it will be included in the raw token data, which can also continue beyond the stop sequence if the sequence ended in the middle of a token.

Applies a bias against generating tokens that appeared in the prompt or in the completion, proportional to the number of respective appearances. More info at https://studio.ai21.com/docs/api/#repetition-penalties

block-definition.s: Hugging face model %'model name' with key %'api key' $nl with input %'data'
block-definition.comment: Can communicate with over 15,000 models. The API key can be obtained from huggingface.co More information at https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-5.html#hugging-face

custom-block.comment: Send the request to Hugging Face.
Turn the response from JSON to Snap! lists.

block.comment: Check if there is an error

custom-block.comment: If the error is that the model isn't ready then wait.

block.comment: Estimates seem too large so try 1/2

custom-block.s: Hugging face model %txt with key %txt %br with input %mult%s

block-definition.s: text or texts input %'text or texts'
block-definition.comment: Input can either be text or a list of texts.

Input are texts that are potential classes for inputs. (max 10 candidate_labels, for more, simply run multiple requests, results are going to be misleading if using too many candidate labels anyway. If you want to keep the exact same, you can simply run multi label=True and do the scaling on your end. )

block.l: Maximum number of candidate labels is 10. You can run multiple times with different labels and combine the results.

block-definition.comment: If true then classes can overlap.
The minimum length in tokens of the output summary.
The maximum length in tokens of the output summary.
The top tokens considered within the sample operation to create new text.
Define the tokens that are within the sample` operation of text generation. Add tokens in the sample for more probable to least probable until the sum of the probabilities is greater than top p.
The temperature of the sampling operation. Value is between 0 and 100. 1 means regular sampling, 0 means top k=1, 100.0 is getting closer to uniform probability.
The more a token is used within generation the more it is penalized to not be picked in successive generation passes. Value is between 0 and 100.
The maximu amount of time in seconds that the query should take. Network can cause some overhead so it will be a soft limit. Value is between 0 and 120.
Input can either be text or a list of texts.
Input can either be text or a list of texts.

block-definition.s: table as a list of lists of text keys and lists %'table'
question(s) %'question or questions' with context(s) %'context or contexts'
block-definition.comment: This can be used to answer several questions at once. If the first input is a list then the second input should have the same number of text elements.

block-definition.s: features %'features' closest to list of features %'list of features'
block-definition.comment: Ranks the 'features' in their closeness to each of the features in the second input. Reports a list of indices into the list of features and the negative cosine similarity between each of the features in the second input and first input. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosine_similarity

block-definition.s: closest words to %'features' in language %'language' $nl and include distances %'include distances' $nl with distance measure %'distance measure'
block-definition.comment: Reports all the words sorted by closeness to 'features'. Optionally can report pairs of words and distances. Distances are measured using cosine similarity.

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Lithuanian Portuguese Sinhalese Spanish Swedish

custom-block.s: closest words to %l in language %txt %br and include distances %b %br do with result %cmdRing %br with distance measure %txt

block-definition.s: closest words to %'features' in language %'language' $nl and include distances %'include distances' $nl do with result %'process result' $nl with distance measure %'distance measure'
block-definition.comment: Passes a list of all 20,000 words in 'language' sorted by how close they are to the first input to the 'prcess result' script. Optionally can pass each word together with its distance to the first input (using cosine similarity or Euclidean distance).

custom-block.s: wait for word embeddings in language %txt %br or use this word embeddings url %txt

block-definition.s: wait for word embeddings in language %'language' $nl or use this word embeddings url %'url'

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Portuguese Sinhalese Swedish

custom-block.s: Load words to features in language %txt then %cmdRing %br use this URL instead of default %txt

block-definition.s: Load words to features in language %'language' then %'do when loaded' $nl use this URL instead of default %'url'

input.options: Chinese English Finnish French German Greek Hindi Indonesian Italian Japanese Portuguese Sinhalese Swedish

block-definition.comment: No longer needed in Snap! 7+ but retained to avoid error from blocks that expect it.

block-definition.s: get API key of %'service provider' and explain %'explain flag' and ask %'ask flag'

list.l: You need to have an API key from
Your key should be kept secret and not shared.
We recommend you read the scripts of this project to be sure your keys will be safe.
You can get a key from

custom-block.l: We can store your key in the browser's local storage. We recommend this only if you are the only user of this computer.

block.l: Enter your key or just press enter if this is a shared computer
OK.Now it is safe to enter your key. It will not be stored.

custom-block.s: Speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br wait %b before doing the next command

block-definition.comment: Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.s: check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'
Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice name or number (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voice names'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

block-definition.s: edit %'input' using GPT-3 with instructions %'instruction' with key %'api key' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Ask the specified GPT-3 engine to edit the input. Input 3 must be your OpenAI API key which you can obtain from https://openai.com For documentation on the options see https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/edits/

inputs.input: What dey of the wek is it?

block.comment: Ignore empty options.
Extracts the completion text from the response.
Extracts the error message from the response.

block-definition.comment: Number between 0.0 and 1.0 that controls randomness. Lower values will result in more deterministic and repetive results. More info at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both. Details at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

custom-block.s: complete %txt using GPT-3 engine named %txt with key %txt %br with options %mult%txt

custom-block.l: The following story has been generated by an AI program. It can edit the story if given instructions. Generate a list of 2 instructions tailored to improve this story:

custom-block.s: get API key of %txt and explain %b and ask %b

custom-block.comment: Ask GPT-3 to generate editing suggestions.

block-definition.comment: Reports the part of the first string up to the first instance of the second string inside it. If the second string isn't found, reports the entire first string.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ antes de _ ca:part del text _ anterior a _

custom-block.s: substring of %txt from position %n to position %n inclusive

block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input string starting after the first occurrence of the second string. If the second string isn't found in the first string, reports an empty string.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ depois de _ ca:part del text _ posterior a _

custom-block.s: substring of %txt from position %n to position %n inclusive

block-definition.comment: Reports the character position (starting from 1) of the beginning of the first input string inside the second input string. If it's not found, reports 0.
block-definition.translations: pt:a posição de _ em _ ca:posició de _ en _

block-definition.comment: If input is TRUE, comparisons made by functions in the string library will be case-independent (so "FOO" = "foo"). This is the default. If input is FALSE, comparisons will be exact.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera comparações ignorando distinção minúsculas/maiúsculas para _ ca:ignora la diferenciació de majúscules _

block-definition.s: substring of %'str' from position %'start' to position %'end' inclusive
block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input (string) starting at the position given by the second input (counting from 1, like LETTER n OF) and ending at the position given by the third input (also counting from 1). If the third input is empty, reports the portion from the first position to the end of the string. If a position number is negative, counts from the end backward, so -1 is the last character, -2 is the next to last, etc.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ entre as posições _ e _ , inclusive ca:part del text _ des de la posició _ fins _

block-definition.comment: Reports True if the first input string contains the second input string, otherwise false. Comparison is case-independent by default; use USE CASE-INDEPENDENT COMPARISONS to change that.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ antes de _ ca:text _ conté _ ?

block-definition.comment: Reports the input text with lower case letters instead of capital letters in the input. Uses the user's locale's rules for case conversion.
block-definition.translations: pt:em minúsculas _ ca:_ a minúscules
ca:comparacions ignorant majúscules?

block-definition.comment: Generates best_of completions server-side and returns the "best" (the one with the highest log probability per token). Results cannot be streamed. When used with n, best_of controls the number of candidate completions and n specifies how many to return – best_of must be greater than n. Note: Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop. Details at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

How many completions to generate for each prompt. Note: Because this parameter generates many completions, it can quickly consume your token quota. Use carefully and ensure that you have reasonable settings for max_tokens and stop. Details at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

block-definition.s: complete %'prompt' using GPT-3 engine named %'engine' with key %'api key' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Ask the specified GPT-3 engine to complete the prompt (or prompts). Input 3 must be your OpenAI API key which you can obtain from https://openai.com For documentation on the options see https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/

block.comment: Ignore empty options.
Extracts the completion text from the response.
Extracts the error message from the response.

scripts.comment: Reports each completion in a list if more than one completion requested or prompts is a list

block.comment: Replaces ' with ’, " with “, new lines with spaces, and removes trailing spaces.

block-definition.translations: pt:um par (chave: _ , valor: _ )
pt:a resposta a _ de _ enviando _ e cabeçalhos _

block-definition.comment: The second input is an "association list," a list of two-item lists. Each of those smaller lists has a "key" as its first item and a "value" as its second. ASSOC reports the first key-value pair in the association list whose key matches the first input.
block-definition.translations: ca:associació _ _
pt:o texto multilinha _ ca:multilínia _

block-definition.comment: How many edits to make in response to instructions. Details at https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/parameter-details

custom-block.l: Text: A girl eats the little bear's porridge, breaks his little chair, and falls asleep in his little bed. Illustration: A girl sleeping in a small bed next to a broken chair and an empty bowl. Text: Her fairy godmother appears and transforms a pumpkin into a golden coach to take Cinderella to the ball. Illustration: A girl is riding in a pumpkin-shaped carriage. Text: A hungry grasshopper begs for food from an ant when winter comes and is refused. Illustration: A hungry grasshopper is begging an ant. Text: Now when the men observed the earth through the lower window, it looked like nothing more than a dark spot, drowned in the solar rays. Illustration: Men looking out of a window at the Earth from far away.

The sun had just set, and the moon was high in the sky. The vampires were getting ready to go out for the night. They were putting on their best clothes and getting their hair done. They were excited to go out and dance the night away, and they were going to have a great time. But there was one vampire who didn’t want to go. He was sick of always being the one who had to stay home and clean up the messes. He was tired of being the one who had to watch over the younger vampires. He wanted to go out and have some fun, but he knew that if he got caught, he would be in big trouble. So, he decided to sneak out. He put on his best clothes and snuck out the back door. He ran across the street and down the block. He turned the corner and was gone. He made his way to the club and danced the night away. He had a great time and he was already planning his next escape. But when he got home, he was in for a surprise. The other vampires were waiting for him. They were angry that he had snuck out and they were going to make him pay. They were going to make him clean up all the messes and watch over the younger vampires. But that wasn’t all. They were going to ground him for a year and make him eat only vegetables. He was going to be stuck at home for a long time. But the vampire didn’t mind. He had had a great time at the club and he was already planning his next escape. He was going to get out of the house no matter what, even if it meant sneaking out through the window.
A story has been generated by an AI program. It can edit the story if given instructions. Generate an instruction to improve the story. Here is the story:

block.var: Abundance of Ideas by Neil Gaiman

custom-block.comment: To paste into the ask and wait block

block.l: Abundance of Ideas by Neil Gaiman

list.l: A train full of silent women plunging forever through the twilight
A man who inherits a library card to the library of Alexandria
A rosebush, a nightingale, and a black rubber dog collar
A city in which the streets are paved with time
A small piece of blue cardboard
A plum, sweet and tart and cold
A were-goldfish who transforms into a wolf at full moon
Two old women taking a weasel on a holiday
A man who falls in love with a paper doll
The sun setting over the Parthenon
An old man in Sunderland who owned the universe, and who kept it in a jam jar in the dusty cupboard under the stairs

scripts.comment: This area is used for doing experiments. Note that the 'Clipboard write" command is a shortcut for saving results to documents and relies upon JavaScript extension. Instead one can use the Snap! export facility instead.

custom-block.s: complete %txt using GPT-3 engine named %txt with key %txt %br with options %mult%txt

custom-block.l: We plan to illustrate a story that can be summarized as:
The paragraph from the story we want to illustrate is:

The tower is the city’s beating heart, and the bells toll out the passing of the days, weeks, months, and years. The sound is like a melody that has been playing for centuries, and it fills the air with a sense of nostalgia. The city is a living, breathing thing, and the streets are its veins. They pulse with the energy of the past, present, and future. The sound of the bells echoes through the streets, and it sounds like the heartbeat of a giant. The buildings seem to sway in time with the rhythm of the bells.
A suggestion for the mood of the illustration is

custom-block.s: get API key of %txt and explain %b and ask %b

watcher.var: Abundance of Ideas by Neil Gaiman

variable.name: story
variable.l: In a city where the streets are paved with time, every step is a journey through history. From the moment you set foot on the first cobblestone, you can feel the weight of the past bearing down on you. Every step takes you closer to the heart of the city, where the clock tower stands. The stones feel like they’ve been there for centuries, and the cracks between them are filled with a dark, viscous substance that smells like tar and feels like it’s alive. The buildings are made of dark, weathered stone, and they seem to be growing out of the ground like trees. The tower is the city’s beating heart, and the bells toll out the passing of the days, weeks, months, and years. The sound is like a melody that has been playing for centuries, and it fills the air with a sense of nostalgia. The city is a living, breathing thing, and the streets are its veins. They pulse with the energy of the past, present, and future. The sound of the bells echoes through the streets, and it sounds like the heartbeat of a giant. The buildings seem to sway in time with the rhythm of the bells. You can feel the weight of the city’s history in every stone, every building, and every step you take. It’s an overwhelming feeling, but it’s also strangely comforting. The city has seen everything, and it will still be here long after you’re gone.

variable.name: history
variable.list: "Description: ",A girl with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia," Story: "," A girl with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia where she meets a man named Sargon. Sargon is the king of a city called Akkad and he is interested in the girl's laptop. The girl shows Sargon how to use the laptop and he is amazed by its capabilities. Sargon asks the girl to show him how to use the laptop to its full potential and the girl gladly agrees. Sargon is amazed by the things he can do with the laptop and he asks the girl to stay with him so he can learn more about this amazing device. The girl agrees to stay and she teaches Sargon everything she knows about the laptop. Sargon is so impressed with the girl's knowledge that he makes her his queen. The girl is happy to have a new home and she lives happily ever after with Sargon in ancient Mesopotamia."," Summary: ","A girl with a laptop travels back in time to ancient Mesopotamia where she meets Sargon, the king of Akkad. Sargon is interested in the girl's laptop and she agrees to stay with him to teach him everything she knows about it."," Instructions: "," 1. Make the protagonist female and the king male 2. Introduce conflict between protagonist and king"," Story: "," A girl with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia where she meets a man named Sargon. Sargon is the king of a city called Akkad and he is interested in the girl’s laptop. The girl shows Sargon how to use the laptop and he is amazed by its capabilities. Sargon asks the girl to show him how to use the laptop to its full potential and the girl gladly agrees. Sargon is amazed by the things he can do with the laptop and he asks the girl to stay with him so he can learn more about this amazing device. The girl agrees to stay and she teaches Sargon everything she knows about the laptop. Sargon is so impressed with the girl’s knowledge that he makes her his queen. The girl is happy to have a new home and she lives happily ever after with Sargon in ancient Mesopotamia. But Sargon is an abusive husband who beats the girl when she makes the slightest mistake. "," Instructions: "," 1. Improve character development for the girl - make her more independent and strong-willed 2. Improve character development for Sargon - make him more likeable and less abusive"," Story: "," A young woman with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia where she meets a man named Sargon. Sargon is the king of a city called Akkad and he is interested in the girl’s laptop. The girl shows Sargon how to use the laptop and he is amazed by its capabilities. Sargon asks the girl to show him how to use the laptop to its full potential and the girl gladly agrees. Sargon is amazed by the things he can do with the laptop and he asks the girl to stay with him so he can learn more about this amazing device. The girl agrees to stay and she teaches Sargon everything she knows about the laptop. Sargon is so impressed with the girl’s knowledge that he makes her his queen. The girl is happy to have a new home and she lives happily ever after with Sargon in ancient Mesopotamia. Sargon is a loving husband and the two live a long and happy life together. "," Instructions: "," 1. Make the protagonist's goal more clear. 2. Develop the relationship between the protagonist and Sargon."," Story: "," A young woman with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia. She meets a man named Sargon, the king of a city called Akkad. He is interested in the girl’s laptop. The girl shows Sargon how to use the laptop and he is amazed by its capabilities. Sargon asks the girl to show him how to use the laptop to its full potential and the girl gladly agrees. Sargon is amazed by the things he can do with the laptop and he asks the girl to stay with him so he can learn more about this amazing device. The girl agrees to stay and she teaches Sargon everything she knows about the laptop. Sargon is so impressed with the girl’s knowledge that he makes her his queen. The girl is happy to have a new home and she lives happily ever after with Sargon in ancient Mesopotamia. Sargon is a loving husband and the two live a long and happy life together. "," Instructions: "," 1. Make the protagonist's goal more clear. 2. Develop the characters more fully."," Story: "," A young woman named Jennifer with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia. She meets a man named Sargon, the king of a city called Akkad. He is fascinated by the laptop and wonders how it works. Jennifer shows Sargon how to use the laptop and he is amazed by its capabilities. Sargon asks Jennifer to show him how to use the laptop to its full potential and Jennifer gladly agrees. Sargon is amazed by the things he can do with the laptop and he asks Jennifer to stay with him so he can learn more about this amazing device. Jennifer agrees to stay and she teaches Sargon everything she knows about the laptop. Sargon is so impressed with Jennifer’s knowledge that he makes her his queen. Jennifer is happy to have a new home and she lives happily ever after with Sargon in ancient Mesopotamia. Sargon is a capable and loving husband and the two live a long and happy life together. "," Instructions: "," 1. Change ""He is fascinated by the laptop and wonders how it works."" to ""He is fascinated by the laptop and asks Jennifer how it works."" 2. Change ""Sargon is so impressed with Jennifer’s knowledge that he makes her his queen."" to ""Sargon is so impressed with Jennifer’s knowledge that he asks her to be his queen."""," Story: "," A young woman named Jennifer with a laptop travels in time to ancient Mesopotamia. She meets a man named Sargon, the king of a city called Akkad. He is fascinated by the laptop and asks Jennifer how it works. Jennifer shows Sargon how to use the laptop and he is amazed by its capabilities. Sargon asks Jennifer to show him how to use the laptop to its full potential and Jennifer gladly agrees. Sargon is amazed by the things he can do with the laptop and he asks Jennifer to stay with him so he can learn more about this amazing device. Jennifer agrees to stay and she teaches Sargon everything she knows about the laptop. Sargon is so impressed with Jennifer’s knowledge that he asks her to be his queen. Jennifer is happy to have a new home and she lives happily ever after with Sargon in ancient Mesopotamia. Sargon is a capable and loving husband and the two live a long and happy life together. "," Summary: ","The rosebush and the black rubber dog collar are friends who spend a night together chatting and singing. The next morning, the rosebush has an idea to help her friend and whispers something in the black rubber dog collar's ear."," Summary: ","A goldfish transforms into a wolf at full moon, but runs into a hunter one day. The hunter is so confused that he leaves the goldfish alone."," Summary: ","Many gryphons believe that they are too strong and powerful to need marriage, but there are some who see it as a way to solidify their power. After a great battle, the gryphons who believed in marriage won and have been living happily ever since."," Summary: ","The gryphons are mythical creatures that are often seen as powerful and strong. Some gryphons believe that marriage is a way to solidify their power, while others think it is a waste of time. The two groups of gryphons fought a great battle, with the group that believed in marriage winning in the end."," Summary: ","Angie sees a head made of light and reaches out to touch it. It speaks to her, saying it is malevolent, and she screams as it moves towards her."," Summary: ","The women on the train are all convicted murderers, although they are all innocent. They develop a bond with each other and realize that they have to stick together."," Summary: ","The vampire in the story is sick of always being the one who has to stay home and clean up the messes, so he decides to sneak out and go to the club. He has a great time dancing the night away, but when he gets home he is in for a surprise as the other vampires are waiting for him, angry that he snuck out."," Summary: ","A vampire who is tired of cleaning up other vampires' messes and watching over them decides to sneak out and have some fun. When he gets back, the other vampires are angry and make him pay by making him do all the work."," Summary: ","In a city where the streets are paved with time, every step is a journey through history. The city is a living, breathing thing, and the streets are its veins."

variable.name: instructions
variable.l: 1. Change "He is fascinated by the laptop and wonders how it works." to "He is fascinated by the laptop and asks Jennifer how it works." 2. Change "Sargon is so impressed with Jennifer’s knowledge that he makes her his queen." to "Sargon is so impressed with Jennifer’s knowledge that he asks her to be his queen."

variable.name: summary
variable.l: In a city where the streets are paved with time, every step is a journey through history. The city is a living, breathing thing, and the streets are its veins.

variable.name: illustration prompts
variable.l: Text: In a city where the streets are paved with time, every step is a journey through history. From the moment you set foot on the first cobblestone, you can feel the weight of the past bearing down on you. Every step takes you closer to the heart of the city, where the clock tower stands. The stones feel like they’ve been there for centuries, and the cracks between them are filled with a dark, viscous substance that smells like tar and feels like it’s alive. The buildings are made of dark, weathered stone, and they seem to be growing out of the ground like trees. Illustration: description = "A cityscape with old, weathered buildings and cobblestone streets. The streets are filled with people walking, and the air is thick with the smell of history." description = "A cityscape with buildings made of dark stone. The streets are lined with cobblestones, and the ground is filled with cracks. In the distance is a clock tower." description = "A cityscape with buildings made of dark stone. The streets are cobblestone and filled with cracks. The clock tower is in the center of the city." style = " dark and ethereal, with a focus on the cityscape." mood = " mysterious." ----------------------------------- Text: The tower is the city’s beating heart, and the bells toll out the passing of the days, weeks, months, and years. The sound is like a melody that has been playing for centuries, and it fills the air with a sense of nostalgia. The city is a living, breathing thing, and the streets are its veins. They pulse with the energy of the past, present, and future. The sound of the bells echoes through the streets, and it sounds like the heartbeat of a giant. The buildings seem to sway in time with the rhythm of the bells. Illustration: description = "A cityscape with a large tower in the center. The tower is adorned with bells of different sizes, and the streets are full of people and cars. The sound of the bells can be heard echoing through the city." description = "A cityscape with a tall tower in the center. The tower is adorned with bells of different sizes, and the sound of them ringing fills the air. The buildings around the tower seem to be swaying in time with the bells." description = "The illustration shows a tall tower with bells at the top. The streets of the city are shown winding around the tower. The sound of the bells is shown as a series of waves emanating from the tower." style = " a mixture of realism and abstraction, with the cityscape being made up of geometric shapes and patterns. The illustration should be colorful and busy, with a lot of movement and energy." mood = " whimsical and nostalgic." ----------------------------------- Text: You can feel the weight of the city’s history in every stone, every building, and every step you take. It’s an overwhelming feeling, but it’s also strangely comforting. The city has seen everything, and it will still be here long after you’re gone. Illustration: description = "A cityscape with tall buildings and a busy street." description = "A cityscape with stone buildings and a busy street. The city seems to be alive, with a pulse running through it." description = "A person walking through a city with tall buildings. The person has a feeling of being overwhelmed but also comforted by the city." style = " a hand-drawn, black and white cityscape with pops of color to represent the passage of time." mood = " solemn but also comforting" -----------------------------------

variable.name: font suggestions

variable.name: illustration examples
variable.l: Text: A girl eats the little bear's porridge, breaks his little chair, and falls asleep in his little bed. Illustration: A girl sleeping in a small bed next to a broken chair and an empty bowl. Text: Her fairy godmother appears and transforms a pumpkin into a golden coach to take Cinderella to the ball. Illustration: A girl is riding in a pumpkin-shaped carriage. Text: A hungry grasshopper begs for food from an ant when winter comes and is refused. Illustration: A hungry grasshopper is begging an ant. Text: Now when the men observed the earth through the lower window, it looked like nothing more than a dark spot, drowned in the solar rays. Illustration: Men looking out of a window at the Earth from far away.
